runs.comm: proud upright seam first ball, swings away from a length, beats the outside edge of the defensive bat. Hardly any carry, though
short of a length, holds its line a little, defended off the back foot
leg-side half-volley, Finch misses out on a boundary. Gets just the leg-bye
tentative - and dare I say - nervous push at a length ball angled across him. No feet there. Beaten
fuller, on off, pushed between mid-off and cover for a single
on off, perfect length too, the ball angles in towards off and middle, defended to mid-on
half-volley, and Warner is away. Yadav bowls a loosener, on off, Warner just meets it with a full face. The mid-off is wide, and he gets four for this push
better length. Can't drive this. Can't go back to this. No swing, though. Defended off the back foot
on a length again, but this time Warner plays with an open face, and gets a single between mid-off and cover
slight shape away from the right-hand batsman. Finch plays watchfully. Towards cover

lovely delivery but no gully. This has opened Finch up. Wide on the crease, angling in, Finch looks leg side, but after pitching on a length this leaves him against the angle, and runs off the thick outside edge through the vacant gully region
short-arm pull for six. Warner not tentative anymore. Yadav pitches short of a length, and on the pads. Not a horrible delivery, but Warner loves this length. He has flick-pulled this over square leg
wide down the leg side as Shami tries to surprise Finch, who mush be expecting outswingers
another inswinger. Beats Finch's inside edge as Finch tries a big drive outside off. This is a full ball, but  just short of driving length

big lbw shout. Looks good on line, but it is bouncing over. Finch again looking for that away swing, and with the ball coming back in he ends up playing around the front pad. Just missing the top of the stumps, though
now he plays a proper defensive shot just outside off
another inswinger, and they are cramping Finch up. Hits his pad again, but headed down leg

another tentative loose shot. This is a wide half-volley, he goes for the big drive, but is early into the shot, and ends up dragging it to midwicket. The bat turns in his hands before the ball arrives
short of a length, outside off, left alone this time. More solid from Finch but an excellent over from Shami

India have struck early. The SCG has erupted. It looks like it is full of Indian supporters. Those six successive dots in the last over might have had a part to play in this. This is short of a length, but fuller than the one Warner smacked for six last ball. He is still looking to play that short-arm pull, realises that the shot is not on, and just checks it. An old-style bat, and this leading edge might have died, bit with the modern Kabooms it flies off the leading edge and settles with cover
full outswinger first up, around the fifth-sixth stump. That is the ball to bowl to Smith. This time, though, he opens the face nicely, and gets a couple past gully
short of a length, at the stumps, he shuffles across to defend
full, just outside off, this is the ball to bowl to Smith, but he is equal to it today, and shows it the full face with mid-off wide. Caresses this for four
short of a length, angling in, defended off the back foot
nonchalantly left alone as this one swings away from a length
beautiful shot. Shami overpitches. Finch just leans into it, shows it the full face, and sends it to the right of the stumps at the non-striker's end. Lovely straight drive.
big inswinger, a touch too straight, and he has picked it off the pads. Gets a couple fine of long leg
short of a length, wide outside off, left alone. Must have been tempting, this ball
length ball outside off, driven nicely, but straight to mid-off
another wide length ball, Finch realises he is not close to the line of the ball, and opens the face late to get a single to third man
tries the full leg-side yorker to look to go behind the shuffling Smith, but his bat comes down in time and flicks this away through midwicket
appeal for leg-before as this shortish ball beats the inside edge of the shuffling batsman. It is bouncing over the stumps
length-ball outswinger outside off. Smith lets it go through to the keeper
good ball. Late away swing from just outside off, but Smith recovers well, plays with soft hands, guides it wide of the slips for a single
full, fast, 149ks, on off, slight shape away, defended to mid-on
full outswinging yorker, at 148ks, beats him both for pace and the swing outside off
short, wide, Finch goes pull as opposed to the cut, and finds mid-on with it
full outside off, slight shape back in, pushed to mid-off
length ball, outside off, left alone. Again a bit of shape back in
on a length, around off, defended to mid-on
shuffles across to pull this short ball to long leg for one
full, shaping in, keeping him honest. Defended to mid-on
wide down the leg side as this one starts too straight and moves further down leg
on a length, pushed towards mid-on with a straight face
shuffles across, takes this from middle and leg, and works it away for a single
short of a length, outside off, pushed wide of cover for one
drives uppishly at a wide length ball, but it doesn't carry to point
moves across again, guides this to long leg for one
he is beaten for pace by this short ball. Hits it high on the bat as he looks to pull. Somehow manages to keep it down. Is headed for the ribs if the bat doesn't intervene
length ball outside off. Defended to point

he is not in control of this pull at all. Head-high bouncer, he is not looking at it, seems to have bailed out of the pull late, but the ball hits the semi periscope. Could have gone anywhere, but this has gone straight down towards deep backward square
fuller, straight, pushed back to the bowler
short of a length, angling in, punched to mid-on
short of a length, this time he shuffles across to work this wide of midwicket for one
full outside off, just holds its line, left alone
on a length, just outside off, defended from the crease

short of a length, wide, Smith lets rip, doesn't quite control it, but finds the gap between point and cover-point. Don't think this would have carried even if it had been hot straight at the man, but fair to say he wasn't in control of the pull
Smith hurts Yadav. Bowled short at 149ks, between waist and chest high, wide outside off, and he has drag-pulled it through midwicket. All along the ground. In full control of this pull
full this time, driven back down the ground, Yadav fields to his left
this is a limp short ball. Shows that Yadav is in his fifth over. Just waist high, Smith shuffles across, and pulls this through square leg to beat the man at short midwicket

this is ordinary bowling. India have used the bouncer well through the World Cup, but this is Australia, and they are not bowling it like they mean it. Only about rig high, and Smith shuffles across to pull it through square leg for four more. All along the ground
defends a length ball to leg
short of a length, at the stumps, bunted into the leg side for one
short of a length, at the stump, defended to leg
slower ball, on off, he picks it and defends
short of a length, at the stumps, worked to square leg
slower ball, short of a length, and again he finds that square leg with that flick. With a normal field Smith would have got at least a couple of singles so far
on a length, just outside off, defended watchfully
full inswinger, pushed to short cover for a crowd catch
length ball outside off, pushed with an open face to point
full outside off, driven to long-off
short this time, why are they feeding Smith? He loves it. Shuffles across, and pulls this through midwicket
full toss outside off, driven to long-off for one
short of a length, outside off, he goes back to open the face, takes a single to the right of short third man
gentle-paced bouncer, only about chest high, and Finch has pulled this powerfully between deep backward square and deep midwicket. This will give Finch some confidence after a tentative start
short of a length, into the pads, works it fine of square leg for one
moves inside the line of a shortish delivery, gets a single to long leg
slower ball, on off, defended
on a length, angling in, defended to leg
missed put. This is down leg and a length ball. On another day Finch glances this for four eyes closed. Today he has not been at his best, and gets just one leg-bye
on a length, middle and leg, defended around the front pad
hits him pad but this is headed well down leg
moral victory for Jadeja as he has already made Finch take big risk. he backs away early, and cuts this from in front of the stumps for a single
down the wicket, right to its pitch, drives it to long-on for one
tossed up outside off, driven to the left of cover, and they get a single despite Rahane's dive here
down the wicket again, what looks like an on-drive for one ends up being a whip through midwicket as his wrists come into play at the last moment
short of a length, on off, he has somehow managed to place it wide of mid-on for one
short of a length, wide, punched away to deep point for one
on a length, just outside off, defended off the back foot
on a length, outside off, opens the face late, gets a single to deep cover
slower ball, short, punched away powerfully to deep cover
punched away to deep cover again
stays back to a length ball and punches this to deep cover
tossed up wide, he sets up a solid base, and smacks this drive powerfully through cover. This is bludgeoned. No niceties about it
this is middle and leg, doesn't turn, hits the inside half of the bat
overpitched, driven to long-on for one
on a length, holds its line, defended back to him
short of a length, punched away to deep point for one more
short of a length, punched away slightly to the right of third man where Shami's arm is taken on, and a couple secured
slower ball, full, on off, defended from the crease
full, on off, hits the inside half of the bat somehow
short of a length, middle and leg, worked away for a single
slower ball but if you bowl them so often, the short and wide delivery counts as a rank poor ball. Cut away in front of point for four
on a length, just outside off, defended to cover
tossed up wide outside off, driven to long-on for one
wide half-volley, he plays for the non-existent turn, hits it off the outside half of the bat, to point
nice dip as he goes slower through the air. Defended off the front foot
short of a length, he goes back to cut, Ahswin is lucky he has found the fielder
this one turns back in to cramp him up, punched down to long-off for one
nicely tossed up wide outside off, some drift, some dip, creates the bat-pad gap, draws an inside edge, but he is safe
tossed up, middle and leg, defended back to Jadeja
pushed straight to the diving short straight midwicket. Dhoni doesn't like the effort. Wants Rohit Sharma to cut that single. "Two steps forward."
defended back to him
defended back to him as he bowls fast and straight
Kohli at short straight cover saves one with his dive. Dhoni likes this better than he did Rohit at short straight midwicket
clipped away off the pads to bring up yet another fifty against India. Smith loves them. They don't him. Fair to say
down the wicket, to the pitch of the ball, drives it to long-on
some dip from Ashwin, defended back to him
big slog sweep attempted, is beaten, but the bounce is taking this over. hence the muted lbw shout
leg spin almost in business. Short of a length, into the pads, goes back to whip it behind square, goes fine of that leg spin. Too fast for the man
short of a length, cut away, Ashwin is lucky Rohit makes the diving save at cover-point. Has saved three runs. Smith not happy he has not placed this perfectly
flighted around off, dips too, defended back to him
down the wicket again, right to its pitch, pushes this to long-on for one
stays back to a length ball, punches it to cover
stays back again as Jadeja pitches this up again. Can't do much with it
stays back again, Jadeja bowls length, he dabs on it, but can't beat short third man
flatter, into the pads, defended
full, overpitched, finally plays down the ground and gets a single to long-on
flat delivery, arm ball, punched to point
slower through the air, regulation offbreak, defended to leg

too short. This will release the pressure. The story of India's summer against Australia. They created pressure during the Tests too, but would release it with a bad ball. This is a bad ball. Short and wide, and is cut away for four
short again, the turn this time means he hasn't placed it well. Straight to cover-point
short of a length, turning into the pads, bunted into the leg side, and takes on Mohit Sharma's arm at deep backward square. Takes the second
nudges this offbreak around the corner for one
on a length, on the pads, dropped into the leg side for a single that takes the partnership to 100
punched down to long-on as he pitches short of a length
flat length ball, defended to leg

huge lbw shout, given not out, but Dhoni has gone against his instinct to review this. Finch is sweeping, is beaten, and the umpire reckons he is outside the line of off. Dhoni thinks the same too, but Jadeja is persistent that he has hit him in the line. Dhoni asks him where he hit him on the pad. Jadeja says the inside part of the bat. Dhoni finally gives in. You can see this is just a risk. Dhoni is not convinced about it. Replays show umpire's call. Desperate review. Wrong review
defended to leg for a single
driven down to long-on for one
lovely shot. Ashwin bowls a wide full ball, an offbreak designed to draw his bat away from the body, but he uses the wrists well to keep this drive down. Against the spin it goes, past the cover
pushed to long-on for one
pushed to long-on for another single
tossed up, slight dip, draws a defensive shot
short of a length, worked around the corner for one
tossed up outside off, pushed to cover
full, middle and leg, pushed to short midwicket
appeal for bat-pad catch, but this has lobbed off the flap of the pad. No bat involved
pushed to long-on

Smith has manufactured the length here. Sees the flat delivery early, this is not short, just short of a length, but he has gone deep into the crease to convert this into a short ball, and he pulled it with a vertical bat over midwicket. Excellent batting
and now he pushes one down the ground for one
this time he gets an inside edge onto the pad, but this has fallen wide of Dhoni
offbreak just outside off, defended with an open face
nice dip on this offbreak, he ends up pushing this to short straight midwicket

he has driven this into the stumps at the non-striker's end, and India are appealing for a run-out. First things first. Ashwin does get a touch on it as he dives, but Finch is alert. He is holding the bat in his left hand, and has gone back immediately as he sees a straight drive from Smith
short of a length, punched away to cover
driven to long-on for one
swept away from middle and leg, awkward slide from Mohit at long leg. A chunk of turn comes off as he slides vertically straight into the ground. Lucky he hasn't done any damage to himself
flat length ball, he stays back and punches, and finds cover-point
down the wicket to drive this to long-off for one
tossed up outside off, he presses forward to push this to deep cover to bring up a subdued fifty. A solid effort nonetheless. Full of character
driven down to long-off for one
overpitched on the pads, worked to long leg for one
lovely shot. A Mark Waugh shot without that elegance. Down the wicket, chips this over midwicket. Easy does it
tossed up, middle and leg, clipped away in the gap deep on the leg side. Rushes back for the second
swept away this time, but straight to deep midwicket, gets just the single
punches this down to long-on as Ashwin bowls flat
full, just outside off, turning in, defended off the front foot
some turn again, into the pads, he deflects it behind square, but finds short fine leg
Ahswin bowls shortish and flat, he goes back to cut, and is disgusted with himself at not finding the gap
short of a length, outside off, a little extra bounce, beats his punch
short of a length, just outside off, punched to cover
down the wicket, drives this length ball in front of deep cover for two
length ball, on the pads, chipped away to deep midwicket for one
short of a length, into the body, punched to the right of midwicket for one
short, waist high, pulled between deep backward square and deep midwicket for two
tossed up, middle and off, pushed to short straight midwicket
swept away hard, takes a single to deep backward square
down the wicket to push this to deep midwicket
full, middle and off, pushed to short straight midwicket
short of a length, worked around the corner, but not wide of backward square leg
slower through the air, flighted around off, defended back to him
short of a length, straight, punched down the ground, straight of mid-on. A good start to the last 20 overs for Australia
short of a length, on off, punched to cover
slower ball, short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover

that's close. Big shout for lbw. Short of a length, nips back in, hits just above the knee roll. It is hitting the stumps, but the impact seems outside off. Replays show umpire's call on impact and also that is only clipping the top of the stumps
full, low full toss, worked to midwicket
short of a length, outside off, dabbed away to third man for one
full, swept away from just outside off, gets a single to deep backward square
down the wicket to drive this to long-on for one
reverse sweep with no third man in place. Gets a couple
makes room to cut this from outside leg, Rohit Sharma misfields at point
reverse-sweeps, is beaten, but is hit outside the line of off
cuts from the line of leg again, but finds cover
short of a length, wide, punched away, but can't beat the man at backward point
short of a length, angling in to off, pushed back to the bowler
low full toss, Smith shuffles across, plays with a closed face, beats short fine leg. For a moment Shami thinks lbw is in business
short of a length, wide, beats the punch
length ball, angling in, he clears the front leg, and slogs this over midwicket for a six. Smith is slowly hitting that next gear

and there is the hundred. Poor bowling. Short ball, waist high. Bouncers get wickets. Just short balls don't. He drags this pull from outside off, beats short fine leg. Removes the helmet. Celebrates the hundreds. Keeps in with the tradition of Aussie Nos 3 standing up tall in big matches
India continue bowling short with no meanness or intent behind the balls. Finch makes room, upper-cuts it, and sends it over point for six. This could just be the turning point in this Finch innings
low full toss, driven to midwicket for one
makes room but drives this full toss straight to extra cover. Misses out
slower ball. Matters nowt. He has picked this early, opens the hip by clearing the front leg, and lofts this back over the bowler's head. The move-on is on. Too early to call a Smith double hundred?
short of a length, into the body, worked away for a single
low full toss, Finch gets inside its line, and provides it a ramp with his bat to launch it over short fine leg for four

India get the breakthrough. Smith won't score a double. Yadav bowls a bouncer that finally gets head high. Smith clears the front leg to hook. Doesn't control it. The top edge settles with deep square leg. Smith raises his bat to the crowd as he walks off
wide down the leg side. A rib-high short ball
wide down leg again as Yadav looks to tuck him up but misfires
angling in, beats the inside edge, concedes a leg-bye
four first ball for Maxwell. Length ball, into the pads, flicked away, square of fine leg. Easy pickings first up
wide down leg again. Yadav is trying to deny them room, but is bowling only down leg
on a length, just outside off, defended to cover
short of a length, wide, cut away to point
on a length, angling in towards off, plays this with soft hands, drops it towards cover, rushes through for one
Maxwell makes room, Shami bounces him, Maxwell tries to cut this down the ground (yes), and gets a top edge over the keeper's head
slower ball, short of a length, runs this down to third man
short of a length, at the hips, nicely glanced fine of fine leg. Yadav clumsy with the dive there. Ordinary ball, ordinary fielding
low full toss, drilled back at him, he gets a touch to it, but the deflection to midwicket yields a single
short ball, rib high, pulled away. Lucky to get away with it. Lucky it has gone straight to long leg
short again, rib high again, helped away for a single

big lbw shout as he plays across the line. The way Finch runs he is looking guilty. Kettleborough gets it right again. This is bouncing over. Finch, though, can be run out, but Raina misses from short cover
just a little short of a length, and Maxwell pulls this Ponting-style for four through long leg. Just helped along the way
oh more Ponting evoked here. This is an ordinary short ball, and he sets up the base to go back and pull this over midwicket for six
yorker outside off, dug out to mid-off
slower ball, but Maxwell picks it and backs away to drill it back over Yadav's head for four. This is pummelled. Absolutely pummelled
low full toss, makes room to slice it, but straight to Rahane at cover-point
length ball, offbreak, bunted to leg for one
slow through the air, well bowled. Dips a little. Maxwell is cramped by the turn. Defended back to him

Ashwin has bowled well, and he has got the big Maxwell wicket. Good field placings, good courage to bowl slow through the air. The ball turns into the pads, he cannot play it through the off side, and doesn't bother keeping the sweep down. Straight down the lap of deep backward square it goes
tossed up, middle and leg, worked ton short fine leg
flat, short of a length, punched, but can't beat point
flat, into the pads, worked away square for one
short, outside off, short-arm pulled to midwicket

good sharp short ball. India are clawing back. They could still keep Australia down to a manageable total. Only Yadav has been able to hurry the batsmen with the short ball. Finch is hurried into this again. This is just outside off, chest high, and does him for the pace. The edge is taken, and caught at midwicket. A hard-working team-man innings from Finch comes to an end
pulled away for one to deep backward square leg
short of a length, just outside off, pushed to cover off the back foot
wide down the leg side. Kettleborough not affected by the appeal for the catch
forward-defensive as he pitches on a length
short of a length, on off, defended back to him
short of a length, flat, straight, worked away for a single around the corner
full, into the pads, driven to long-on for one
tossed up on off, driven to long-off for one
flat, short of a length, punched down to long-off for one
shimmies down the wicket, Jadeja slows it down a little, Clarke defends to leg
another shimmy, and another forward-defensive
square-drive a wide length ball, Jadeja dives to his wrong side at point to save three runs
bouncer, good bouncer, higher than the shoulder, Clarke pulls out of the pull
short of a length, on off, runs this down to third man for one
wide length ball, he stays back to cut, but finds the man at point
bouncer again, and again he gets it higher than the shoulder. He withdraws from the pull. Two good bouncers this over
half-volley outside off, crunched away, but straight to mid-off
and there is the boundary. A length ball, fired into the pads, he uses all the pace of the ball, and chips it over midwicket for four
slower through the air as Clarke shimmies, gets some turn, draws a defensive shot
fired into the pads, this time he has a fielder on the boundary in front of square on the leg side. Gives away just the single
flat and straight, no room, pushed to cover
makes room to punch this length ball to long-off for one
length ball, into the pads, dropped into the leg side for one

another wicket for India. This is a soft dismissal. A little luck for them. This is a short ball. Not a bouncer. No menace behind this. Only waist high. Clarke can see a four over midwicket, but just doesn't get the elevation he desires. Finds Rohit Sharma there. This is what a break in momentum does to you. Slight uncertainty, and a boundary ball has resulted in a catch in the infield
short of a length, on off, punched to extra cover
short of a length, no room, has hit the bat as opposed to the bat hitting the ball. Heavy ball. Hits the shoulder of the bat as he defends
on a length, tails in towards off, pushed to mid-on for one
low swinging full toss, clipped to deep midwicket for one
short of a length, pretty straight, defended to leg
on a length, no room, he defends to short midwicket
down the wicket, beaten in the flight as this dips on him, flicked to that midwicket again
flatter, quicker, pushed to cover. No run again. Pressure. Excellent from India
down the wicket, not to its pitch again, drives this wide of long-off for two
looks for the big hit down the ground, but Ashwin is bold, slower through the air, getting the ball to dip, creating the gap between its pitch and Watson's reach. Defends

and there is the Watson slog sweep. This can get his innings going. Finally Ashwin goes flatter. Possibly to protect a good over. Watson likes it that he has pitched it within his reach. Sends it sailing over midwicket
short of a length, straight, worked to leg for one
slower length ball, Watson has picked the field well with no sweeper back on the off side, and he makes room to go over cover. Not the best connection, but clears the infield
that's lucky runs for Faulkner. Good bouncer from Shami, gets it shoulder high, Faulkner looks to drag it from outside off, gets a top edge over the keeper's head
this short ball is not that great. A bit tired really. This is only chest high, and he has pulled this between deep backward square and long leg
makes room, Shami follows him up with the endangered species - the yorker. Just the single off the inside edge
another yorker, tailing back in, following him, kept out by Watson, but the desired result for India: a dot ball
Faulkner the finisher. Faulkner the party pooper. Slog-sweeps this flat over midwicket for six. Hits the gloves that are left to dry there
makes room to expose the cover field as India strengthen the leg-side field. Raina, though, makes a diving save at cover to save three runs
Watson looks for a slog sweep this time, gets an inside edge into his back pad. Credit Jadeja for pulling the length back
bowls a round-arm fast ball outside off, hurries Watson up. Another dot
clever bowling. Sees Watson backing away, and fires in a wide yorker. Well bowled
another flat fast delivery wide outside off, this time Watson drives it to deep cover for one
nails this punch to deep midwicket. Gets a single
full, just short of the yorker length, and he has slogged this straight of deep midwicket. Amazing how he keeps missing the fielders

Faulkner goes after that cameo. Yadav bowls full and straight. Fuller than a length ball, just short of a yorker. Faulkner swings across the line to go over the leg side. Misses it altogether as it tails back in. Timbah
lovely yorker as Haddin makes room. Right on the crease. Dug out by Haddin, but that is a perfect delivery
short of a length, quick, no room, 143ks still, Haddin is making room but is cramped
Haddin is usually stylish down the ground, but this is just power. No elegance, just effectiveness. Makes room to drill this full ball straight of mid-on
makes room to drive a length ball wide of cover for four. The worst ball to bowl at this stage is length
slower ball, has him there, Watson has to check that slog, but the top edge somehow clears square leg. Lucky for Watson
short ball, but not the Yadav variety. Easy to pull this as there is hardly any nasty pace behind this. Pulls this wide of deep midwicket. Now he reaches a run a ball
well bowled. A yorker outside off as he sees him back away. Dug out to point

slower ball, in his slot, this time he has picked the slower ball, but he has cramped him for room, and his slog settles with deep square leg. Just can't get enough power behind this shot because there is no rook available
slower ball, Haddin reads it late, but opens the face to get a single to short third man
this is in the slot. Half-volley outside off. Haddin has mis-hit this. Another dot. Straight to mid-off

that mid-off nearly takes a catch. Haddin mis-hits a full ball again, but it bounces just short of mid-off. The single takes them to the first-ever 300 in a World Cup semi-final. Will we see another later this evening?
but he is not bowling to his field. The field is there for the short ball, but he bowls length, and Johnson carts him over wide mid-on for four first ball

he bowls short, according to his field, but Johnson has made room to pay an exceptional shot. He has punched this over wide mid-off. Yadav chases well, but inn the end the slide is clumsy, and Johnson gets four
now that the third man comes in and mid-off goes back, Shami bowls the shortest ball of the over, and Johnson's top edge clears short third man
yorker, middle and leg, but Johnson has dug it out for one
slower ball, on a length outside off, he mis-hits it, but the bunt goes into the on side with no man inside the circle. Gets a couple
another slower ball, this time he has hit it harder towards deep midwicket. Won't get the second
another slower ball, hit towards deep midwicket, Kohli charges in, gets both hands to it, but drops it. Warner seen clapping that from the balcony
full toss with mid-off up not the best ball to bowl. Has missed the yorker in all likelihood. Drilled over mid-off for four
this was telegraphed. Johnson was expecting the slower ball, and he has drilled it flat, and between long-on and deep midwicket. Flat six to cow corner
short of a length, at the body, no room, they get just a single
